H0.text: Using light energy to produce sugar is an activity carried out by both Euglena, a single‑celled photosynthetic organism, and clover, a multicellular green plant.

H1.text: Producing sex cells for reproduction is the activity carried out by both Euglena, a single‑celled photosynthetic organism, and Clover, a multicellular green plant.

H2.text: Moving nutrients to specialized tissues is carried out by both Euglena, a single‑cell photosynthetic organism, and Clover, a multicellular green plant.

H3.text: Transmitting impulses along nerve pathways is an activity carried out by both euglena, a single‑celled photosynthetic organism, and clover, a multicellular green plant.

A4.text: In plants and algae, photosynthesis takes place in organelles called chloroplasts.
